CatDescriptText: Mrs. Adelaide Yarborough, 223 38th Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 1, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that high school students should strike in order to air grievances or to gain their objectives?"  Answer reads: "Definitely not! I feel if students, by such actions, are able to control the teachers, the teachers do not have any control of the classroom."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Adelaide Yarborough wearing earrings and light colored coat, holding bag under left arm, standing in front of light colored stone building
